resources.string: Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested

string-array.name: note_inText
string-array.item: Hello, Good Morning! Today is Sunday, Feb 18th 2024. Have a great day!
Attention! I have detected Newcastle Disease among your chicken from the records a few minutes ago.

Excuse me for the interruption! The amount of Temperature sensed in your poultry house is too high which is not suitable for the chicken. Please consider regulating immediately to avoid unnecessary Infections. Thank you.

Excuse me for the interruption! The amount of Humidity sensed in your poultry house is likely to be caused by wetness in the floor. Please consider changing the wood lashes immediately to avoid unnecessary Infections. Thank you.

Excuse me for the interruption! The amount of Ammonia sensed in your poultry house is likely to be caused by too much manure. Please consider cleanliness immediately to avoid unnecessary Infections. Thank you.
Attention! It seems like there is a Power outage. Please use the backup Power immediately to resume monitoring. Thanks.
Attention! I have detected Coccidiosis Disease among your chicken from the records a few minutes ago.

Excuse me for the interruption! The amount of Temperature sensed in your poultry house is very low which is not suitable for the chicken. Please consider regulating immediately to avoid unnecessary Infections. Thank you.

Excuse me for the interruption! The amount of Humidity sensed in your poultry house is likely to be caused by wetness in the floor. Please consider changing the wood lashes immediately to avoid unnecessary Infections. Thank you.

Excuse me for the interruption! The amount of Ammonia sensed in your poultry house is likely to be caused by too much manure. Please consider cleanliness immediately to avoid unnecessary Infections. Thank you.

resources.string: Fowl Cholera is a chronic disease caused by Pasteurella Multocidathat can affect the joints, wattles, infraohits, sinuses and other tissues. Common symptoms include loss of appetite, diarrhea with a greenish tinge, ruffled feathers, swollen purple wattle, swollen comb, swollen joints, lameness, oral, nasal and ocular discharge and sudden death. Most commonly found in older chickens, Fowl Cholera affects more cocks than it does hens

Coccidiosis is a parasitic disease caused by Coccidian protozoa that lives in and damages a specific region of the gut in chickens. The trouble starts when chickens consume a sporulated oocyst which is broken down by chemicals in the gut, releasing an infective sporocyst. This begins the life cycle that causes the destruction of intestinal epithelial cells. Together with damage to the gut walls, it causes loss of appetite, diarrhea, ruffled feathers, weight loss and inability to absorb nutrients.

Avian influenza is a disease caused by type A Orthomyxoviruses. They are commonly found and spread by wild aquatic birds which infect domesticated poultry. Diarrhea, nasal discharge, edema in the comb and wattles, purple discoloration, coughing and sneezing, swelling, ruffled feathers and more are symptoms of the bird flu. Once spread, avian influenza is deadly.

Newcastle disease is an acute respiratory disease that can spread rapidly. Symptoms of the disease depends on whether the infecting virus has a predilection for respiratory, digestive, or nervous systems. While it can affect both wild and domesticated fowl, domestic poultry is much more susceptible to contract severe symptoms.

Salmonellosis is a bacterial disease that can cause septicemia and enteritis in young chickens. With a low mortality rate, infections are contracted orally and can be spread by rodents. Symptoms of salmonellosis include diarrhea, closed eyes, loss of appetite, thirst, ruffled feathers and dejection.

2.1. The PDDC app is intended for use by poultry farmers, veterinarians, and other individuals involved in poultry disease detection and control.
2.2. You must be at least 18 years old or have reached the age of majority in your jurisdiction to use this system.
2.3. You agree to use the System in compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and ethical standards.

3.1. The PDDC System is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. We make no warranties, expressed or implied, regarding the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of the information provided by the system.
3.2. We do warrant that the App will be error-free, uninterrupted, secure, or free of viruses or other harmful components.
4.1. We are committed to protecting the privacy of our users. Please refer to our Privacy Policy for information on how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information.
4.2. By using the System, you consent to the collection and use of your data in accordance with our Privacy Policy.
5.1. The PDDC system, including all content, features, and functionality, is owned by us and is protected by intellectual property laws.
5.2. You are granted a limited, non-exclusive, and non-transferable license to use the App for its intended purposes only.
6.1. In no event shall we be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or in connection with your use of the System.

6.2. Our total liability to you for any claim arising out of or relating to these Terms and Conditions or your use of the System shall not exceed the amount paid by you, if any, for accessing the System.

We reserve the right to modify these Terms and Conditions at any time without prior notice. By continuing to use the System after such modifications, you agree to be bound by the updated Terms and Conditions.
These Terms and Conditions shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of our Jurisdiction, without regard to its conflict of law principles.
If you have any questions or concerns about these Terms and Conditions, please contact us at [sleizwaredevelopment@gmail.com].
1.1. Information You Provide: We may collect personal information that you voluntarily provide when using the System, such as your name, email address, phone number, and other contact information.
1.2. Usage Data: We may also collect information about how you use the System, including your interactions with the System features and functionalities.
2.1. We may use the information we collect for the following purposes:
To provide and maintain the System;
To personalize your experience and improve the System\'s features and functionalities;
To communicate with you and respond to your inquiries;
To send you updates, newsletters, and promotional materials, if you have opted in to receive them; and
3.1. We may share your personal information with third-party service providers who assist us in operating the System, conducting our business, or servicing you.
3.2. We may also disclose your information in response to valid legal requests, such as a court order or subpoena, or as otherwise required by law.
4.1. We take reasonable measures to protect the security of your personal information and prevent unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
4.2. However, please be aware that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

5.1. The App is not intended for use by individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 18. If you are a parent or guardian and believe that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us to request deletion.
6.1. We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be effective immediately upon posting the revised Privacy Policy on this page.
If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at [sleizwaredevelopment@gmail.com].

The PDDC System is a comprehensive tool designed to assist poultry farmers, veterinarians, and other stakeholders in the effective detection and management of diseases affecting poultry populations. The system leverages artificial intelligence (AI) and Internet of Things (IoT) technologies to provide users with accurate and timely information for disease prevention and control.

Our mission is to empower poultry farmers and veterinarians with innovative technology solutions to enhance disease surveillance, early detection, and effective control measures, ultimately contributing to the overall health and well-being of poultry populations.

Our vision is to become a leading provider of AI and IoT-based solutions for disease detection and control in the poultry industry, driving positive outcomes for both poultry producers and consumers worldwide.
Copyright \u00A9 P D D C 2025, All rights reserved.
